subject: 1150a 6/21 Update: Shuttle entry delayed at least one orbit by weather
body:
1150a 6/21 Update: Shuttle entry delayed at least one orbit by weather



=================================

CBS NEWS STS-117 STATUS REPORT: 85
Posted:11:50 AM, 6/21/07

By William Harwood
CBS News Space Analyst

Changes and additions:

   SR-83 (06/20/07): MMT clears Atlantis for entry; final issues resolved
   SR-84 (06/21/07): Astronauts prepare for entry; Russian computer test on tap
   SR-85 (06/21/07): Atlantis entry delayed at least one orbit due to weather

=================================

11:50 AM, 6/21/07, Update: Atlantis entry delayed at least one orbit due to weather

Entry flight director Norm Knight ordered the Atlantis astronauts to hold up re-entry preparations and to delay their return to Earth by at least one orbit because of low clouds and predicted thunderstorms near the Kennedy Space Center.

While forecasters are not optimistic, Knight has not yet ruled out a possible deorbit rocket firing one orbit later, at 2:25 p.m., for a landing on runway 15 around 3:30 p.m. If the weather doesn't improve, commander Rick Sturckow and his crewmates - pilot Lee Archambault, flight engineer Steve Swanson, Patrick Forrester, Danny Olivas, Jim Reilly and returning space station astronaut Sunita Williams - will remain in orbit an additional day and try again Friday.
